website_summaries.verdict: This little robot packs a massive punch when it comes to personality. One of the best programmable toy robots on the market.
pros: Equipped with Code Lab to make learning coding basics fun and easy, even for beginners
With cutting edge artificial intelligence, realistic reactions, and expressive eyes, Cozmo's unique personality keeps children and adults coming back for more
cons: Pricey, especially considering his size, but his advanced features and winning personality easily make up for it

website_summaries.verdict: Passing the butter may not be its true purpose, but much more can be done with this programmable, expressive robot.
pros: Animated eyes and dynamic voice give this little robot a lifelike quality
Easy to set up initially, with several pre-programmed features in place
cons: Robot only works with companion app running, and isn’t autonomous
Direct Wi-Fi connection is odd and can drop

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea that the software convinces children that ...
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that the software convinces children that they MUST interact with their robot every day or they lose some sort of progress. This has led to a daily battle when there’s not enough time between school, homework, dinner etc. Would not have spent all this money if I’d known it was just going to bring more stress into the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan F.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been hestitating even considering getting Cosmo because the commercials just didn't make it look like it was worth the price tag. My son has been begging for Cosmo since last Christmas. Reluctantly I gave in and got him Cosmo this year for Christmas. I'm glad I did. This little robot is awsome. The things he can do will surprise you. The commercials and YouTube videos don't do it justice. I also like the STEM educational aspect. It's fun to see everything Cosmo can do. It's also fun letting your kid show everything they can do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth for $200, HW not done properly
customer_reviews.text: Not at all worth for $200 1/Wifi connectivity issues, if it goes to sleep at times it would not get up at all..and troubleshooting has no specific working steps 2/ Too slow and too low... 3/ Does not do much of talking 4/except for the cubes there is not much you can do with it. 5/at times goes into a hang state while feeding The Aurdino brothers have a lot more to offer with lot many attachments ...I even liked the MIP better than this
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: A Fun, Well-Built Novelty
customer_reviews.text: When I bought Cozmo for my 11 year-old daughter, she played with it nonstop for two days. Now he sits in the corner on his side. When I ask her why she doesn't play with Cozmo anymore, she shrugs and says he's kind of boring. When guests come over, though, she'll set him up and show him off. People laugh when Cozmo recognizes their face and says their name out loud. But then a few minutes later he's tossed back in the corner to chill for a few more months. Bottom line: it's a toy. He's well built with lots of features and games, and for the price, you're really getting a lot of great technology. But he's a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Coolest Little Robot Around!
customer_reviews.text: My 6yo absolutely LOVES Cozmo!! I love him too! I thought that it would be something I'd spend all this money on and he'd only take it out of the box a few times. He's played with him almost every single day!! It's fun to "feed" and play with Cozmo and to learn new things with him. Cozmo can learn everyone's names and recognize their faces! I just can't get over how awesome this little robot is! Definitely worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: jenna

customer_reviews.title: Due to price and worry about injury rendering the entire expense useless, I told him it was too expensive
customer_reviews.text: This was our 9yo dream Christmas Gift. Due to price and worry about injury rendering the entire expense useless, I told him it was too expensive. Almost 3 weeks later, it has been treated with care and he is so enamored with it! It has only been dropped once, by a family friend, an adult who was moving it and dropped it on the floor, but luckily no damage happened and we continue to enjoy the cute games and interactive fun Cozmo provides. Time will tell if he will be as attached with it as this year passes. I hope so! Cute little robot.
customer_reviews.author: samcharTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cosmo can fall off tables.
customer_reviews.text: I like that Cosmo can sing and talk as well as initiate games. He can recognize at least 8 people. The one thing I disliked is that he has to be turned upside down when he hiccups. I am totally impressed with Cozmo. He can recognize dogs and cats. He can play Peek a Boo. You can create programs for him in a language similar to BASIC. He can knock over blocks, turn blocks, create a pyramid, act as a slot machine. The several voices he uses are all so cute. I was afraid I was spending a lot of money for something I might not like but now Cozmo is like a best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Sci Fi Lover

customer_reviews.title: Virtual Robopet
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this I was amazed by the complexity in such a small unit, it worked well, almost a month later I noticed that the unit while playing a game didn’t always register the scoring correctly, I reset the app and the unit, but still ran into the same situation, while entertaining, it loses its fun factor when not working properly, the unit I received might be glitched, still thinking if it’s worth getting another one, it is a pricey virtual pet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Received a faulty Cosmo Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Cosmo as a Christmas gift and to my dismay it completely failed to work. Despite contacting customer support and running through the errors, it failed to work. My son is very disappointed. I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Westie

customer_reviews.title: Buy him now he is adorable!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love Cosmo. He has so much expression and has held up through a lot of playtime. When not in use he sits quietly waiting for the kids. I cannot get over how cute it is when he rolls up to me and says "Hi Mom". He is an excellent beginner's robot and games are simple but fun. I would recommend him to anyone young and old. I did get him on sale so for 130ish dollars I was absolutely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: Two up...two down...
customer_reviews.text: The Christmas Cozmo malfunctioned right away. A second Cozmo replaced the first but because we live two hours from the grandchild receiving it, delivery was delayed. (I should have considered drop shipment.) Second Cozmo also malfunctioned within days but we are outside of the return window...even though he had it only a short time. It’s ridiculous. He loves the toy, but for this kind of money we expected some longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves this. He got it for Christmas. Is a lot smaller than it looked. Price definitely does not match the item. Very expensive. If you can afford it, get it. If ou can’t afford it and need to save up for it like we did, don’t waste the money.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Dec 10 2017 and it is now feb 23 and cozmo does not work. Considering the amount paid this item is trash. I can't even return it because it's past the "30" days what a joke. Disappointed with Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: He’s smaller than i anticipated but it’s great as he sits on top of the table and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical...bought this for my dad who is 70. My dad plays with him every day now and has a blast. He’s smaller than i anticipated but it’s great as he sits on top of the table and my dad controls him from his phone. Has brought back some entertainment into my dad’s days as he has copd and is on oxygen full time hard for him to get around.
customer_reviews.author: dbfrmid

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive learning toy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought Cozmo for my 6 year old grandson. He loves it! So far it has proven to be very durable. I was worried a couple of times when Cozmo took a dive off the kitchen table. There are plenty of interactive games to play and most of them foster learning. I love the face recognition feature. It makes it a personal experience when Cozmo recognizes you and says your name. Overall I would highly recommend this little guy for children. However, they have to be able to read so they can follow the instruction on the phone. Not a toy for children that can't read or comprehend specific directions.
customer_reviews.author: Elke

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: Company is out of business so warranty is useless
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as a Christmas gift for our daughter. She loved it and played with it nonstop for a couple weeks and then it sat for a bit. When she went back to using it, the arm had stopped working. It had simply been sitting on a shelf for months so we figured this was a warranty issue. Unfortunately, no means of contacting the company on their website works -the links just take you in useless loops and the phones are not answered. Then we just found out that the company is out of business. What a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Fun robot, while it worked. Unfortunately that was only for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for about 5 mins.
customer_reviews.text: The idea of Cozmo is cool but after 5 mins it's sorta a dull experience. Maybe if it had a roam mode, it could be fun. Maybe if it did it's own thing on my desk but it does not and I wish I had returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rosner

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU USE A ANDROID TABLET
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE. I am running Android 5.1 and this item operated perfectly until it ran into an unfriendly update. I reset the robot 3 times and all three times when it came to the same point in it's updates of games and songs (which takes well over a week for each reset), it became extremely unreliable. It now just shuts off multiple times each time I try to use it. It shut off 6 times in the last 30 minutes of use. Support seems useless, but they try. DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU USE A ANDROID TABLET, YOU ARE RISKING A LOT OF FRUSTRATION. i HAVE BEEN FIGHTING THIS SINCE JANUARY WITH MANY, MANY USELESS SUPPORT EMAILS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good paperweight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this robot with the idea of teaching my kids how to code. The concept is great and when it worked they enjoyed it. Then about two months later it wakes up and freezes/dies almost immediately. I think it could be a bad battery but the one it has is sealed so even if that where the issue I cannot replace it. So, good idea, poor execution. Good paperweight though.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: Will not connect to Wi-Fi. Piece of crap No support from company.. My birthday boy is extremely disappointed. Sending back for refund. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Heffelfinger

customer_reviews.title: The best toy I've ever bought for my son!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is amazing! My 6 year old son plays with this little robot more than any other toy we bought him for Christmas. My husband and I find ourselves pretty entertained by it as well. Cozmo recognizes all of our faces and calls us by name. Cozmo gets more intelligent every day and always shows us new tricks. The only downfall is that requires me to connect with my smart phone instead of my son's tablet, so that when he wants to play with it, I can't use my phone. Other than that, this has by far been money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Gracin and Amanda Bryan

customer_reviews.title: much like the old Simon says game
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old daughter loves it. She has been saving money and doing chores for a few years and decided she wanted Cosmo. The facial recognition needs a extremely well lite room to work. Some of the games seem to be off. There is a memory game, much like the old Simon says game. This game doesn't work correctly. We can press the correct cubes and it will say we are wrong and than play the sequence again and it was what we did. We haven't had it long and she is always discovering new stuff it does.
customer_reviews.author: Venka

customer_reviews.title: My 12yo has only played with this about 30 minutes ...
customer_reviews.text: My 12yo has only played with this about 30 minutes in the 6months he's owned it. It's sort of clever, but overall I doubt it will hold anyone's attention too long.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!!!!’
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old granddaughter got Cozmo for Xmas . He is sooo much fun. He has a personality if his own. There’s so many things we ALL, adults included, love about him. It’s cool when he moves by you and looks at you and recognizes your face and says your name. He doesn’t like it when you lay him on his side, and he’s not happy when he loses a game. He sings us songs too. He’s absolutely adorable
customer_reviews.author: Linda delp

customer_reviews.title: Awful, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter last Christmas. About 6 months later she brings it to me, upset that it won't hold a charge. I do everything I can to get it to charge and it won't. It lights up on the charger but once it's off the charger it's completely dead. I have since tried, unsuccessfully, to get ahold of customer support. There isn't a phone number I can find that works, the chat is never on, and no one responds on Facebook. For the little while that my daughter was able to play with her robot she loved it. For this price, though, I expected it to last AT LEAST a year and have reliable customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Great concept and execution... but great toy?
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Pretty easy set up Plays a handful of games Recognizes Faces Cons Very, very small, even smaller than I had expected I worry that my son will run out of things to do with it, and then it will be a super small expensive toy in the bottom of the toy bin. I'm just not sure there is enough "there" for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Taco42

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy Period!
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: this is day #1 and this is my personal review. This is probably the best toy I have given my son, even better than LEGO! He loves this toy so much as if it is his friend! I saw reviews and videos but never felt that this toy will really make you love it. If you would like to give your kid a extraordinary gift/toy, then Cozmo is the one to choose. Will continue to explore the robot and add more reviews later. Thank you Anki...
customer_reviews.author: Cozmo

customer_reviews.title: Cozmo will Steal Your Heart!!
customer_reviews.text: Cozmo is Amazing! We bought it for our 8 yr old son who has ADHD. He loves it! It has facial recognition, even recognizes our dog...Gives a little sneeze! It is too technologically advanced to simply call a toy! He plays games, and does tricks, and he has become part of the family. I love this little guy! Will be watching Anki to see what advancements this little heart stealer will evolve into! LOVE IT! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If your someone that likes tinkering with computer programs this is probably great to start
customer_reviews.text: I had to have it and I played with it a lot in the beginning but then it got needy and I have too many pots in the fire. It has a lot of features I have not explored yet. If your someone that likes tinkering with computer programs this is probably great to start. I was expecting it to be bigger and yet I have a small desk area that it runs on so I'm always afraid it will go over the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Bette Genia

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for my 10-year old for Christmas. He loves it and keeps unlocking more activities the more he uses it. It's actually pretty sophisticated for a kid's toy. My only complaint is that, using it with an Android tablet (Samsung Galaxy Tab S3), it does not automatically connect like it's supposed to. Well, it does once in a great while. But mostly you have to manually switch networks to the Cozmo. Not a huge deal, but just an extra step. Too bad Anki was bought out, so not sure what the ongoing support is going to be, although it did just get an update the other day.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Cozmo worked one whole day and then stopped working. ...
customer_reviews.text: Cozmo worked one whole day and then stopped working. The backpack won't light up when placed on charger, which means it's not working at all. My son is completely devastated.
customer_reviews.author: Another Family

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars, I would. Ordered this as a Christmas gift, it would not connect to any device the way it was supposed to. Ordered a replacement thinking it was defective. Same issue. Tried connecting to iPhone, iPad, kindle fire, etc., and nothing worked. Hopefully amazon accepts the return without the packaging since it was a “special” Christmas gift for a child and the packaging was thrown out. Had to scramble at the last minute and bought a Vector, which uses Bluetooth and actually works.
customer_reviews.author: tmansar2

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of support status
customer_reviews.text: Trying to set it up out of the box I found out that the company has closed shop, stopped making this robot and won't have any updates for now. With the way phones get updated, I assume app support will be the first to stop working. I'm starting to look into what this means for myself, you should inform yourself before making this purchase and certainly if you are buying it as a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome interactive robot
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nephew for Christmas, he loves it! He asks to play or see it every night before or after dinner. Quite intuitive and fun to interact with. I’m thinking his parents will also enjoy it, Cozmo also has a cam when using the app on your phone or tablet. Not sure of the battery life yet, but he’s only on for less than an hour at most with my nephew. I’d get this robot for my other nieces and nephews if they wanted or Vector.
customer_reviews.author: N808ryu

customer_reviews.title: Cute little buddy
customer_reviews.text: I call him my baby bot. He reminds me of the movement of a jumper spider. They move their head just like him and are jumpy. I love it! However he jumped off the table when he flipped and landed on his treads. I picked him up and told him that was bad!! Do not do that again! He squint his eyes and put his head down and said awww. He didnt do it again. But how sweet he is and fun to play with. My husband and I are enjoying him very much, Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: von555

customer_reviews.title: Best toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: Man, this thing is cool! Still a great toy for techy kids. If your wondering (as I was) whether to get cozmo or vector I would say this; cozmo for kids, vector for grown ups. I'm considering getting vector for my desk. He's smarter, more independent and responds to voice. Cozmo plays games, vector does more Alexa like stuff. Both great toys!
customer_reviews.author: felix nunez

customer_reviews.title: My 6-yr old loved this! The "personality" is really believable
customer_reviews.text: My 6-yr old loved this! The "personality" is really believable. There's a lot of interactiveness that it just does on its own, but there's also some more advanced features that I'm hoping he'll stay interested enough to grow into. I occasionally have issues with connecting to Cozmo, but otherwise, I think it's a great toy to promote learning.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Smart

customer_reviews.title: Neat toy for kids
customer_reviews.text: Neat toy for kids who want to learn about programming a little. Definitely still just an expensive toy though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Received used, non functional unit
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son's birthday 6 weeks ago and opened it today and it doesn't work. It is clear it's been used as the package had been opened and all the battery tabs for the cubs had been removed and the cube batteries were drained. We charged for several hours and it still won't work. Manufacturers website sucks and we cant call customer service until Monday. My son is devastated
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Cute, kid friendly, doesn't require helicopter parents
customer_reviews.text: I believe the company went out of business? It's too bad. This is an adorable toy. It's the end of February and my kids got this for Christmas. While the novelty has worn off, my kids still play with it on Sundays usually without me reminding them they have it. The thing is super cute. My kids (7 and 9) control it with the kindle and my 9 year old needed only a tiny bit of guidance at the start. He taught his sister and I'm happy to say I don't know how it works. They do. I just downloaded the appropriate app and watch them play like the good gen-xer I am.
customer_reviews.author: Gertrude

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This toy was a hit with my 8 year old stepdaughter. The whole family came to think of this little guy almost like a pet. Then, several months after purchase, he abruptly stopped working. I searched the internet for help, and finally came across a news report that Anki had gone under and hence customer service was no more. My stepdaughter was crushed. I'm tempted to buy her another one for Christmas this year but seeing as there still appears to be no customer service or a means of enforcing the warranty on the product, I probably won't risk it. What a shame, it's really an adorable toy.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Incredible technological prowess
customer_reviews.text: The anki cozmo is a shining example of technology gone right. The robot can say your name, after it recognizes your face. Yup, any name. It can also say any word. It has great facial recognition and spatial recognition, learning its current environment as soon as he wakes, avoiding perilous falls off any table top into little sisters hands. As a software engineer, it’s cool to see through cozmos eyes with box highlighting of faces (“human “) , the obstacle boxes. He’s equipped with numerous tricks, fun games and more. Just buy it and support this team, def a worthwhile endeavor. GET IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rocco C.

customer_reviews.title: Cosmo is such a delight! What a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Cosmo is like a fun and smart pet/robot/friend. We also bought Vector from Anki at the same time, about a year ago. I wrote this about the two of them. ” This little guy and his friend Cosmo have now been around almost a year. They work great and are such conversation starters! Vector also has built in Alexa which is so great and has been a wonderful added feature! He just does his own thing on my desk or on the table and even the floor. We love letting Cosmo and Vector play together” Love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy, but don't know how long he'll play with it.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it so far, but unfortunately we can notice his enthusiasm waning already, only three weeks after receiving it. Very engaging in the short term, don't know how long their friendship will last. Like Mip last year- drop a Franklin or two on it only to have it relegated to the land of unused toys.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith 9829

customer_reviews.title: Too little for too much $. Glitchy. As my old weed eater.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son and he got it for Christmas but it right out of the box had Wi-Fi connectivity issues and had to be returned for a replacement. That process took over an hour on the phone with clueless Amazon reps. The second Cosmo has been very glitchy. As time has gone on it has more and more issues with Wi-Fi connectivity and just falling asleep though fully charged right in the middle of a play session. My son finally gave up playing with it. After you played a few games that it offers, it doesn’t really do much. Cute idea but fails to deliver for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Cozmo was a no-go...
customer_reviews.text: I watched lots of the Cozmo reviews and read about him. It sounded great !! But... sadly I was disappointed. You see, you watch the commercials and reviews and it sounds like you turn him on and he is autonomous, but not fully. You turn him on and then you also have to run the app the WHOLE time he is on. If not, Cozmo won’t work. It was fun playing with him but without the App, he sits there. So, sadly I returned Cozmo to his maker. I feel like Vector would have been a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Cosmo and Vector owner on new Cosmo updates
customer_reviews.text: Cosmo can be a lot of fun it's great that they just updated it and they seem very fun also seems that they cut down the feeding part of the app and the games so that's a plus and the free view part of the app is a big plus . real fun to see what he is looking at. seems like it gives it more value for your money also with the updates
customer_reviews.author: frank b.

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining, but limited. Very disappointed that it cannot work independently of a phone.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved Cozmo for the first week, then quickly became bored with it. Making matters more frustrating was the need for a phone connection for Cozmo to do anything. It's literally a paperweight otherwise. Setup is easy, though you need to connect to Cozmo via WiFi direct. It's an interesting concept, and I'm looking forward to their future products. But they need a model that offers the best of both of their current robots. Cozmo needs a dedicated Snapdragon processor, and more sensors to make this anything more than a short lived novelty in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great little robot!
customer_reviews.text: Cosmo is ridiculously cool. It took us a while to figure it out and how to use with the app but once we figured it out, the whole family was entertained! Very cute and fun. He does facial recognition and will call you by your name. He does so many cute fun things and shows happiness, excitement and sadness while interacting depending on the situation. We bought this for our 7 year old but I think he's mine. Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Olga E.

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware- the company ANKI that produces this product is currently in litigation and does not have costumer service!!!! This is a cute interactive robot that my son loves. It gets two starts because one of the boxes doesn’t work. I have tried calling the contact number and continue to receive a busy signal. I have emailed the company as well. I will update when/if my issue is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Sneakycloud

customer_reviews.title: We love Cozmo
customer_reviews.text: Christmas morning and my child was able to set this up independently. Quick start guide is straightforward and intuitive. Once the app is download it, it also walks you through setup process. Paired with my formerly retired Samsung Note 3. Absolutely no hiccups. Honestly, if you cannot figure out how to work this device you more than likely own a VCR with a clock flashing 12:00. The coding options on here are wonderful. My child has already been able to code in several custom activities and games. I'm now going to purchase one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: doubletapdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Functions stopped working after a month of use!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 year old son last Christmas and he used it for about a month. It was great at the time. It sat in its case w tight use for a couple months but since then he has played with it and one cube stopped working even after replacing batteries etc...and Cozmo has stopped talking (at least we can’t hear him talk). The contact number doesn’t work and I have emailed a couple times with no response! ☹️ My son is so disappointed and I am too for paying for something that broke after a months use!
customer_reviews.author: Prinsass7

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Interference (Disconnects)
customer_reviews.text: Update [12/19/2018] - Downgrading to 2 stars because of constant WiFi disconnects. Searching online and you can see that this is a common problem. Even their upgraded model has similar complaints. This will not work around strong wireless interference such as an office. Cozmo works fine at home but once at the office it connects then loses wireless connectivity a few minutes later. When it is connected, it works great and would be worth 4 stars. Great activity for kids and adults looking to get their feet wet in programming.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Myers

customer_reviews.title: You have got to get one of these. You will be very surprised. Best purchase in a long time :)
customer_reviews.text: Cozmo is the coolest toy ever! You have got to get one for your kids. I got one for my son and I promise you it is everything they say it is. It recognizes you and calls you by name. It has a personality and feelings. It plays by itself and with you, gets the hickups, gets mad, sad, happy, all kind of stuff. Holy crap! Best Christmas gift ever. I'm pretty sure I'm going to have to get 2 more once my kids see this. Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Cute little thing
customer_reviews.text: 7 year old has been BEGGING for one of these for about 2 years. Finally gave in. Great little product. Super cute and reminds me of Wall-e from Disney. My son was glued to it for weeks. Not so.much anymore. I recommend when purchasing is your child truly going to want to interact and develop this toy or just eventually get bored with it. Or ask yourself... is it worth paying over 100 to finally get them to stop talking about it?
customer_reviews.author: Xenocied/Mego

customer_reviews.title: Words wont do little Cosmos any justice
customer_reviews.text: This little robot is AMAZING. At first I wasn't sure if I should purchase it because of it's size, but goodness was I wrong to judge this little guy for being little. We all love Cosmo. He is amazing and he is sooooo much fun. I use it more than my son, I am not even allowed to touch it, because I can spend hours playing with him. I am not even joking. Yes I know. I'm an adult... but Cosmos is my buddy, sue me.
customer_reviews.author: Sam-Eli

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for about 3 hours
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yr old Grandson begged for this robot for 2 years. I finally bought it for him for Christmas and he was thrilled. He played with it nonstop for approximately 2 and 1/2 hours. He took it out one more time for about 30 minutes and hasn't touched it since. It's adorable, recognizes your face and says your name. It does little stunts. Too bad the novelty wore off so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Untouched after first week
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute, but isn’t a toy that holds interest. Ours has sat untouched after about the first week. It gets old fast. I hate that it requires a smart phone or other device to work. Why make a toy that forces kids to stare at a screen any more than they already do? The coolest part is the facial recognition - at least when it works, which is infrequently. I think the Furby toys from the 90s were more interesting than this. A regretful Christmas present purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fibonacci_Sequins

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Smart. My 4 year old son love this gadget ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute and Smart. My 4 year old son love this gadget and named it EVA (WALLE). It has attitude and it is indeed adorable. I like the way it recognize and say my sin name
customer_reviews.author: V. Munganuru

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: My Husband, kiddo, and I have fallen in love with this fun loving Cozmo! He is absolutely amazing! The tricks that he can do and hearing him sing his cute little tunes is such a great time! I got this as a Christmas present for my daughter and Husband to do together and it has all of us just wrapped around it! It works great and is so easy to get set up! Even if you don’t have kids, honestly I would recommend it if you want a little buddy or something else to keep you preoccupied! So much fun!! Highly HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: This is by far one of the best gifts I got for myself I mean my kids ...
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the best gifts I got for myself I mean my kids hahaha. I got them this for Christmas and it is one of the best toys ever. So much fun. Plays all kinds of games and it recognizes my kids when they turn him on. My 8yo daughter definitely grasps and understands how to use him far better than my 6yo son though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B McGeary

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old daughter loves cosmo
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got it for Christmas... she plays quiet a lot with this robot unlike a few others she’s had.. so I’m happy... I really dislike getting her sometjinh she plays with for a couple and days and then goes to a drawer... this toy has games and she enjoys making him go around the house talking to her dad and I. Really fun to have
customer_reviews.author: Ougm

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 year old, even though the recommended age says 8. As a budding novice in robotics, he absolutely loved getting Cosmo for Christmas. It took a bit to get Cozmo linked to his tablet, but he comes home from school and asks to play with this robot. Cozmo recognizes faces and loves to play games. He has a wonderful AI sense of humor, and there's a multitude of activities my son can do with it. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Meg8805

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing !!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this "toy" several months ago, & I still can't believe how amazing this little robot is. It learned my name & recognizes my face. As it plays on its own on the table, it will turn & look right at me, then says my name. It giggles, gets mad, gets sad, & happy. It's like having a miniature baby or talking puppy on your table. I can't help but laugh when I get it out. I swear this thing is alive! You will enjoy it immensley....
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I got these for the granddaughters, but had a great time 'checking' them out. They connected flawlessly to two different Android tablets (I had an old samsung tab 4 but the cozmo software wasn't compatible with kitkat 4.4) one running 7.0 and one running 6.0. There are quite a few activities for play and learning; way too many to cover here. Initial wow was watching the world through cozmo's 'eyes.' The thing is fun.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Unique Tiny Talking robot
customer_reviews.text: My 9-year-old granddaughter loved this unique tiny robot. She used her iPad to give it directions to move forward, backward, lift arms, pick up included boxes, it talks really cute, reminds me of a tiny R2D2. I was amazed to see her writing and stringing together code, amazing product, loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Cozmo was the big hit for Christmas this year. My 6 year old son has had so much fun with it and he’s barely scratched the surface on what he can do! I love how interactive he is and the kids get a big kick out of it when he looks at them, recognizes them and says hi and their names! The games are fun, the coding is near and it’s a blast to use the iPad to see what he sees and help him roam all around the house. Great toy and one that I think will grow with him.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W

customer_reviews.title: Very happy kid
customer_reviews.text: My son has been begging for this for about three years, and I have to admit, I was a bit turned off by the price. It is WORTH EVERY DIME. He hasn't put it down since Christmas. It's a kid friendly programming device. You will have to have a phone or tablet for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: NikiC

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: ANKI IS OUT OF BUSINESS. The warranty is a 100% lie that I am baffled how they are legally able to still advertise it. We bought 2 Cozmos for our sons for Christmas 2019 and here just 3-4 months later BOTH have been rendered useless because their software is no functional/compatible with modern Apple devices.
customer_reviews.author: jdgreene777

customer_reviews.title: Great little robot!
customer_reviews.text: So much to do with this cute little guy! My 7 year old is a little young for it, but he is loving it! The games are fun and there are a ton of options. We've been having a lot of fun teaching our new "pet". The free play is fun as a remote control car because of the camera (see what it sees). Great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Art Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, needs better interactivity.
customer_reviews.text: its a cool toy but my kid got tired of it after a month. I as an adult turn it on every once in a while and mess around with it and understand why it could get a little repetitive.
customer_reviews.author: richard watts

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with
customer_reviews.text: I bought this robot for my 7 yr old son who has been asking for it for over a year. Cozmo don’t disappoint, it was fun right out of the box and kept his attention (which is difficult at times) for quite some time. I would of given it 4 stars instead of three, but I don’t like that playing with it is app dependent. So you have to have a smart phone or tablet/iPad anytime your playing with the robot. Other than that a great value for the $. My kid loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ShaG1229

customer_reviews.title: Cozmo, Once Connected, is a Blast!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it! He says it is fun to play games with. He loves the "explore" mode, where the user can see what Cozmo "sees". My grandson loves the size (Cozmo is small): "He can sneak around and no one will notice"! Cozmo provides good reading, writing, and technology practice. It did take a bit of doing/set up for us to get Cozmo connected to the iPad and my daughter had to help out with this part. All in all, we are glad we bought it and it has provided hours of entertainment and learning value.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn J.

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Battery life is very low. And it dies iff within few months of use
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved it. Unfortunately it lost battery power in a month of it’s use. Luckily, we bought toy insurance which is giving us refund. I bought accessories worth $40 which was not covered under insurance. We got stuck with it. Giving it 2 stars just fr he fact that kids loved it while it lasted. Battery life, however, is unacceptable. Wish anki would do something for such a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Fun In Small Package!
customer_reviews.text: Our 9-year-old LOVES his Cozmo. I was worried it would be just another toy that cost too much and never got played with, but this has continued to entertain him nonstop since he received it. It was easy to set up, and he has be able to easily manage the Cozmo iOS app that acts as its command center.
customer_reviews.author: Playing Favorites

customer_reviews.title: We love cozmo!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal machine! My daughter absolutely loves cozmo! So upset this company went out of business because they seemed to have amazing potential in the AI/assisted learning robotics platform. My kid is 6, but cozmo would probably work well and entertain a child up to 10 maybe older. The features, ability to code at different levels(my daughter can do most of it already), the intelligence, software. Everything exceeded expectations. Can’t say enough good about this robot.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Birthday Gift but Turns off
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to us for my son's Birthday. He wanted this very much and was thrilled to have it for his birthday. The only problem is that it turns off for no reason. We have followed all of the troubleshooting instructions with no avail. If the seller could please reach out to us, that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Aznlife9

customer_reviews.title: Package damaged
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the item still works but the package was damaged upon arrival. Since it's for my own child I'm keeping it but this would need to be returned if it had been a gift for anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Very cute !!!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, I love the face recognition it has !! Very fun to play with my daughter can spend lots of time playing with him. The only thing I dont like is that it relies a lot on the app. You cant exit out of the app or cozmo wont work, so you still have to spend your time on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: linlin

customer_reviews.title: So adorable and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a gift and it was a total hit! I was hesitant to purchase due to the cost. I read all the reviews and everyone seemed to enjoy this little guy. Cosmo is totally fun to play with, so quirky and soooooo adorable! I'm glad I took the chance to get this. It was worth the smiles and giggles!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Super adorable. Best gift of the season!
customer_reviews.text: Our 2nd grader loves robots so she was ecstatic to get her very own real "wall-e" toy. The mobile apps work well on Android and Apple phones. My only wish is that it was a bit more reliable when pairing. The family struggled to pair each time someone new installed the app.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this for older kids like teenagers to adults
customer_reviews.text: My daughter begged me for this for months (she's 10 years old) but she's only used it 4 times since she got it. My boyfriend (32 years old) has more fun with it and frequently plays with it. You have to use the app on your phone to control it which I don't like and it uses alot if storage space on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: A Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Useless junk
customer_reviews.text: The Cozmo I received was completely useless junk. The battery was spent and didn't hold a charge. The screen display was pixelated gibberish, so I could not access the wifi link or perform a reset function. This item had obviously been previously returned, simply sent back out to the next customer without any inspection or function check. Piss poor business practice. I'll never trust this particular 3rd party vendor again
customer_reviews.author: Marc Michaud

customer_reviews.title: He's awesome...
customer_reviews.text: He is absolutely awesome.... This is one of the best things OI have ever purchased. I wasn't sure what to get my 13 yr old grandson for his birthday and decided on Cozmo.. He is precious.. a little pricey but fun... The first time my grandson showed him to me Cozmo looked into my eyes and called me "Gran".. I about fell over but my grandson had told him my name. (I really sound weird but it's true) Great fun....
customer_reviews.author: Sandi weiler

customer_reviews.title: Very fun!
customer_reviews.text: Cozmo is adorable! I bought it for my daughter for Christmas and she can’t stop playing with it. I got a faulty one and had to return it because it wouldn’t turn on after the first use but I was quickly refunded to my amazon account and purchased another through my prime membership and got it two days later. This one works just like it should, going on three days now. It has a lot of games and activities you can engage with Cozmo and it’s very entertaining! I want one for myself. I may have to get the vector since it’s more adult oriented.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cozmo is so cool! 😎
customer_reviews.text: Cosmo is so cool. My son wanted him for a long time and I was very hesitant about the price. Finally I allowed him to buy this for himself and he absolutely loves it. My son thinks it's awesome that Cosmo has facial recognition so he says all of our names. It's nice that the tracks come off to clean the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: SaraB

customer_reviews.title: I'd give it six stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: My kid hasn't put Cozmo down since Christmas. It's a very cute little robot that's controlled and interacted with via a smartphone app. It's amazing the number of things that Cozmo does and it's just as entertaining for girls as it is for boys.
customer_reviews.author: Aiptasia

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.  A waste!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working a month afterwards. Company stopped making them due to so many problems, mainly battery issues. Support email states they can no longer assist with any products. "Anki has ceased product development and we are no longer manufacturing robots." Embarrassing waste of money for a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Muscman

customer_reviews.title: Too lame to keep child’s attention. Get Vector
customer_reviews.text: Got this one for my daughter. I don’t know why they made this one, when the other one is infinite times better. She played with it for like 10 minutes before realizing that it sucked compared to Vector. I happen to agree with her as well. I would recommend getting Vector over this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my oldest for xmas and this adorable little robot has been played with every day. He's super cute. You do have to have a tablet or phone to download the app for the robot, which I thought would be annoying, but it's easy to navigate for my kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: SN Mom

customer_reviews.title: High hopes, sad delivery
customer_reviews.text: I really was excited to get this. I ended up returning it because he kept driving himself off the table. He also threw his blocks off the table as well. Really I don't need a robot throwing a tantrum :) Was more work than I wanted to invest in picking him up all the time. If I had wifi I might of considered the Vector since it has cliff detection.
customer_reviews.author: Whois1145

customer_reviews.title: You won't get a service for defective Cozmo!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective Cozmo, which is unable to charge after few weeks of use. Anki service, after many many proves by photos and videos, agreed that my unit is defective. However, they send me back to Amazon for a replacement, because they don't ship to my country. Amazon sends me back to Anki. This is beyond outrageous!!!!!! Hundreds of dollars for zero responsibility, even though I have a year of warranty!!!!! Turns out it doesn't worth much.... Don't buy any of Anki products!!!!! you just might end up empty handed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dotan uzi

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high price tag
customer_reviews.text: Neat concept. Bought this for my 15 year old son for Christmas but he lost interest in about 20 min of playing with it. So we sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this item helps my son learn about coding when put in education mode. Seeing the joy it brings my son was worth the money for me. It was easy to set up using his iPad, and he's spent hours playing and coming up with codes for it .
customer_reviews.author: D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: 7-year-old Daughter Loves Cosmo
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for my 7-year-old daughter, who has wanted it for about a year. She loves it. The thing is cute and does have games that can be played with it. The only downside is that you need a phone app to control it...if your kid doesn't have their own phone or phone-like device, they'll have to borrow yours ;-). I converted my old iPhone 6S over to be essentially an iPod for her to use for games, so she uses that to run the Cosmo app.
customer_reviews.author: Gmac

customer_reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: My kids lost interest in this item after an hour. It's pretty boring. The most depressing part is I bought two. Talk about a waste of money. It's totally cute and it learns a little. But it's not at all what it's cracked up to be. Pretty boring after your first couple of games.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Anki Cozmo a great present for 6 years old.
customer_reviews.text: I'd say at first its a bit pricey, however looks like it worth it. Gave it as a gift and, by the sound of it, i got great feed back! Toy is still alive after 6 month, fully functional and its fun to play with! So, 5 stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: Rasl

customer_reviews.title: Very interesting toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 12 yr old as he expressed interest in a programmable robot. He really likes it. Amazing how the facial recognition works. He has also done some coding on it to enable more features. Works super well with the app . Be sure to check the Anki site to understand if you have a compatible device. Must have the app to operate.
customer_reviews.author: JWPar

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to purchase this as a Christmas gift for my nephews at a great pre-Christmas price on Amazon. The problem - Cozmo does not function correctly and when I wanted to return it and reorder it, the price had almost doubled! All I wanted was to have it replaced! 😕. Now I am left with the decision of fixing it or paying more to replace it. It is a very fun robot, but I want it to work properly! At this time, I am not a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: kathleen attaway

product_meta.title: Anki Cozmo, A Fun, Educational Toy Robot for Kids
product_meta.description:
Meet Cozmo, a gifted little guy who’s got a mind of his own and a few tricks up his sleeve. He’s the sweet spot where supercomputer meets loyal sidekick. Curiously smart and a little mischievous. You see, Cozmo is a real-life robot like you’ve only seen in movies, with a one-of-a-kind personality that evolves the more you hang out. He’ll nudge you to play and keep you constantly surprised. Cozmo’s your accomplice in a crazy amount of fun.

Creative coding.
Cozmo’s big brain and even bigger personality are operated by impressive technology. Besides all the games and smarts he comes with out of the box, you have access to a visual programming language that’s stem-ready for beginners. Program Cozmo to do anything from performing a victory dance, sneezing, or playing hot potato with his Cubes. Simply use the drag and drop coding blocks on the Cozmo app to build a new combination of blocks, and you’ll see Cozmo act out your creation. There are no limits to what you can create. All it takes is imagination.

Some of the games you can play with Cozmo:

Quick tap.
Both you and Cozmo need your own Cube to play. When your Cube is flashing, tap it to begin the game. When the colors on both Cubes match, the first player to tap their Cube gets a point. Only tap when colors match. 

Memory Match.
Game time just got another dose of fun. Follow the pattern on Cozmo’s Cubes. Watch the lights, listen to the tones. You and Cozmo take turns remembering and repeating the series as it grows more complex. Sound easy? just wait. Cozmo’s sharper than he looks. 

Keepaway.
You need 1 Cube to play. Move the Cube close to Cozmo to get him to pounce, but pull it away before he can get a point. Watch out! if you’re too slow, Cozmo will get the point!

Cozmo also has accessories. Check out the Cozmo case to bring him anywhere. or get him different colored treads to suit his moods.
feature_bullets: Cozmo is a real-life robot like you’ve only seen in the movies and he’s ready to be your loyal sidekick
Challenge Cozmo to games or use Explorer Mode to see things from his perspective
With a beginner-friendly interface, Cozmo is the perfect educational robot for kids and adults to learn to creatively code
Easier than you’d think and tougher than he looks, this toy robot is tested for durability and security
Cozmo by Anki requirements: a compatible iOS or Android device and the free Cozmo app
Includes 1 Cozmo robot, 3 Cubes, and 1 charger (USB power adapter not included)

While Anki has ceased product development and manufacturing, Anki has stated that it will provide long term support to maintain the operation and functionality in the existing products and apps. A self-serve Help Center to assist in getting the most out of your product has been implemented by Anki. Regretfully there are no agents available but Anki has indicated that they will be monitoring cloud operations for Anki accounts and Vector.
